intro: Epilobium laestadii, commonly known as the alpine willow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or alpine environments, where it forms dense cushions or low shrubs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in terminal racemes. Epilobium laestadii is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to withstand cold and harsh weather conditions.
